q: Most of us will do anything to avoid facing ourselves.
h:
“Most of us will do anything to avoid facing ourselves.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: It's easy to be a critic, but being a doer requires effort, risk, and change.
h:
“It's easy to be a critic, but being a doer requires effort, risk, and change. ” —
Wayne Dyer

q: What people say, what people do, and what they say they do are entirely different things.
h:
“What people say, what people do, and what they say they do are entirely different things. ” —
Margaret Mead

q: There is no way to happiness - happiness is the way.
h:
“There is no way to happiness - happiness is the way.” —
Thich Nhat Hanh

q: Concentrate all your thoughts upon the work at hand. The sun's rays do not burn until brought to focus.
h:
“Concentrate all your thoughts upon the work at hand. The sun's rays do not burn until brought to focus.” —
Alexander Graham Bell

q: A hopeless man is a very desperate and dangerous man, almost a dead man.
h:
“A hopeless man is a very desperate and dangerous man, almost a dead man.” —
Robert F. Kennedy

q: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.
h:
“The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.” —
Mahatma Gandhi

q: Optimism is the one quality more associated with success and happiness than any other.
h:
“Optimism is the one quality more associated with success and happiness than any other.” —
Brian Tracy

q: Knowledge isn't power until it is applied.
h:
“Knowledge isn't power until it is applied.” —
Dale Carnegie

q: The educated differ from the uneducated as much as the living differ from the dead.
h:
“The educated differ from the uneducated as much as the living differ from the dead.” —
Aristotle

q: Any idea, plan, or purpose may be placed in the mind through repetition of thought.
h:
“Any idea, plan, or purpose may be placed in the mind through repetition of thought.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: Perfection is not attainable, but if we chase perfection we can catch excellence.
h:
“Perfection is not attainable, but if we chase perfection we can catch excellence.” —
Vince Lombardi

q: To do great work one must be very idle as well as very industrious.
h:
“To do great work one must be very idle as well as very industrious.” —
Samuel Butler

q: The wiser you get, the less you care to look like a fool.
h:
“The wiser you get, the less you care to look like a fool.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: The whole of life, from the moment you are born to the moment you die, is a process of learning.
h:
“The whole of life, from the moment you are born to the moment you die, is a process of learning.” —
Jiddu Krishnamurti

q: Your friends will know you better in the first minute you meet than your acquaintances will know you in a thousand years.
h:
“Your friends will know you better in the first minute you meet than your acquaintances will know you in a thousand years.” —
Richard Bach

q: Nothing is particularly hard if you divide it into small jobs.
h:
“Nothing is particularly hard if you divide it into small jobs. ” —
Henry Ford

q: The greatest weariness comes from work not done.
h:
“The greatest weariness comes from work not done.” —
Eric Hoffer

q: The wisdom of life consists in the elimination of the nonessentials.
h:
“The wisdom of life consists in the elimination of the nonessentials.” —
Lin Yutang

q: The eye with which I see God is the same eye with which God sees me.
h:
“The eye with which I see God is the same eye with which God sees me.” —
Meister Eckhart

q: No man is more cheated than the selfish man.
h:
“No man is more cheated than the selfish man.” —
Henry Ward Beecher

q: It is never too late to be what you might have been.
h:
“It is never too late to be what you might have been.” —
George Eliot

q: Each day your life grows a day shorter. Make every move count.
h:
“Each day your life grows a day shorter. Make every move count.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: You can, you should, and if you're brave enough to start, you will.
h:
“You can, you should, and if you're brave enough to start, you will.” —
Stephen King

q: A person who does not read is no better than one cannot read.
h:
“A person who does not read is no better than one cannot read.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: Growing up is losing some illusions, in order to acquire others.
h:
“Growing up is losing some illusions, in order to acquire others.” —
Virginia Woolf

q: Life is a succession of lessons, which must be lived to be understood.
h:
“Life is a succession of lessons, which must be lived to be understood.” —
Ralph Waldo Emerson

q: Confidence is consistency of thinking about what is possible and how to make it possible.
h:
“Confidence is consistency of thinking about what is possible and how to make it possible.” —
John Eliot

q: The quality of your commitments will determine the course of your life.
h:
“The quality of your commitments will determine the course of your life.” —
Ralph Marston

q: Whenever people agree with me I always feel I must be wrong.
h:
“Whenever people agree with me I always feel I must be wrong.” —
Oscar Wilde

q: Life is really simple, but men insist on making it complicated.
h:
“Life is really simple, but men insist on making it complicated. ” —
Confucius

q: Truth is such a rare thing, it is delighted to tell it.
h:
“Truth is such a rare thing, it is delighted to tell it.” —
Emily Dickinson

q: Employ your time in improving yourself by other men's writings, so that you shall gain easily what others have labored hard for.
h:
“Employ your time in improving yourself by other men's writings, so that you shall gain easily what others have labored hard for.” —
Socrates

q: We will outstretch the hand if you unclench your fist.
h:
“We will outstretch the hand if you unclench your fist.” —
Barack Obama

q: To find yourself, think for yourself.
h:
“To find yourself, think for yourself.” —
Socrates

q: Anything worth doing is worth doing slowly.
h:
“Anything worth doing is worth doing slowly.” —
Mae West

q: You give but little when you give of your possessions. It is when you give of yourself that you truly give.
h:
“You give but little when you give of your possessions. It is when you give of yourself that you truly give.” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: You don't get in life what you want; you get in life what you are.
h:
“You don't get in life what you want; you get in life what you are.” —
Les Brown

q: Whoever is happy will make others happy too.
h:
“Whoever is happy will make others happy too.” —
Anne Frank

q: The best answer to anger is silence.
h:
“The best answer to anger is silence.” —
Marcus Aurelius

q: Life is too short to waste your time on people who don't respect, appreciate, and value you.
h:
“Life is too short to waste your time on people who don't respect, appreciate, and value you.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Your best life will not be found in comfort. It will be found in fighting for what you believe in.
h:
“Your best life will not be found in comfort. It will be found in fighting for what you believe in.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: If we are honest with ourselves, most of us will have to admit that we live out our lives in an ocean of fear.
h:
“If we are honest with ourselves, most of us will have to admit that we live out our lives in an ocean of fear.” —
Jon Kabat-Zinn

q: One always begins to forgive a place as soon as it's left behind.
h:
“One always begins to forgive a place as soon as it's left behind.” —
Charles Dickens

q: If you can handle rejection, you'll learn to get everything you want.
h:
“If you can handle rejection, you'll learn to get everything you want.” —
Tony Robbins

q: As a man thinketh in his heart, so shall he be.
h:
“As a man thinketh in his heart, so shall he be.” —
James Allen

q: One's best success comes after their greatest disappointments.
h:
“One's best success comes after their greatest disappointments.” —
Henry Ward Beecher

q: All men are equal before fish.
h:
“All men are equal before fish.” —
Herbert Hoover

q: To achieve, you need thought. You have to know what you are doing and that's real power.
h:
“To achieve, you need thought. You have to know what you are doing and that's real power.” —
Ayn Rand

q: The destiny of man is in his own soul.
h:
“The destiny of man is in his own soul. ” —
Herodotus
